---

**I've always loved story songs because there's so much that can be done message-wise through said medium.**

---
One of my favorite artists, and potentially my *all time favorite artist*, is:   
[Harry Chapin ↓↓↓](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Chapin)   
![Harry Chapin](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/33/Harry_Chapin-1980.jpg/330px-Harry_Chapin-1980.jpg)
**→→→(Chapin in 1980)**

---
# One of my favorite songs is called A Better Place to Be
[![A Better Place to Be](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MazXSlekckI)
**→→→(Click Image to Listen)**

## Description of Song:
This song depicts a story of a lonely man, discussing with the bartender/waitress, a one night stand he had the week before. It was, as said in the song, a kind of scene he could have only imagined in his head; this meaning she was the most *ideal/perfect* form of a partner he could have asked for. 

This leads to the climax of the song, where the two make love; this being told in an implicit way. Although it seems as if everything is going great for the man, an issue arises after he wakes up and goes to get them both food.

He comes back to find that she was gone, having left a six word letter saying: "It's time that I moved on." Having told this sad story to the waitress, she feels sympathy for the man, even shedding a tear.

She decides that because they have both been so lonely, anywhere is a better place to be, and she'd rather go with the man than be alone at the bar. So in the end, all is somewhat resolved, leaving the audience with a decent level of satisfaction.

---
***Harry Chapin* has many other songs with similar and deeper messages within them. I'd fully recommend giving him a listen if you haven't, and would go as far to say you are doing a diservice to folk music if you don't.**
